Which statements about exception handling and file I/O are correct? (Select all that apply)
answers: Using 'with open(...)' ensures the file is closed even if an exception occurs
'try-except-else' runs else only if no exception is raised
'finally' executes only when an exception occurs
Catching broad exceptions with 'except Exception' can mask errors
